name: Z-sequence for the Riordan triangle A125166.
comment: For the Z-sequence of a Riordan trangle R(G(x), F(x)=x*Fhat(x)) see the first W. Lang link in A006232, where also references are given,
The Z-sequence implies a recurrence formula for R(n, 0) using the previous row entries of R.
R(n, 0) = Sum_{j=0..n-1} Z(j)*R(n-1, j), for n >= 1, and R(0, 0) = G(0), usually 1.
The o.g.f. of the Z-sequence of R is GZ(y) = (1/F^{[-1]}(y))*(1 - 1/G(F^{[-1]}(y))), with the composition inverse F^{[-1]} of F.
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (-7,-12,-6).
author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Mar 25 2025

name: Triangle R(n,k), companion to A125165, left column n^3.
comment: Riordan array ((1 + 4*x + x^2)/(1 - x)^4, x/(1 - x)). - _Philippe Deléham_, Dec 09 2013
link: Paolo Xausa, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..11475 (rows 0..150 of triangle, flattened).
formula: Binomial transform of an infinite matrix M with diagonal D, subdiagonal (D-1)..., etc; as follows: (D) = (1,1,1...); (D-1) = (7,7,7...); (D-2) = (12,12,12...); (D-3) = (6,6,6...). Alternatively, given left border n^3: (1, 8, 27, 64...); for k>1, R(n,k) = R(n-1,k) + R(n-1,k-1).
R(n, 0) = (n+1)^3, R(n, k) = R(n-1, k-1) + R(n-1, k), for k >= 1. (from the (finite) A-sequence {1, 1} with offset 0),
R(n, 0) = Sum_{k=0..n-1} Z(j)*R(n-1, k), for n >= 1, and R(0, 0) = 1, with the Riordan Z-sequence A382057. For Riordan A- and Z-sequences see the first W. Lang link in A006232.
R(n, k) = Sum{j=0..3} A028246(4, j+1)*binomial(n, k+j). (Proof for k=0 with a standard (n+1)^3  formula, and for k >= 1 using the Pascal type recurrence for the triangle.)
O.g.f. column k (with leading 0s): (1 + 4*x + x^2)/(1 - x)^4)*(x/(1-x))^k. (Numerator polynomial from row 3 of the triangle A008292.)
O.g.f. row polynomials P(n, y) = Sum_{k=0..n} R(n, k)*y^k:
example: With other offset (k >= 1) from first formula: R(5,3) = 146 = R(4,3) + R(4,2) = 46 + 100.
... refomatted and extended by _Wolfdieter Lang_, Mar 25 2025.
program: [list(u) for u in list(gf.O(11))]  # _Peter Luschny_, Apr 02 2025
